lines.content: * The Kenobi program implements a chatbot that manages a list of tasks.
* Constructs an instance of Kenobi with the specified save path for storage.
* @param savePath The path that directs to the storage that Kenobi uses.
* The program initializes user input and storage then greets the user.
* The AddCommand class encapsulates the command to add a Task to a given TaskList.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the given name for the new task.
* @param name The name of the Task to be added.

* @param name The name of Task to be added.
* @param date The date attached to the Task to be added.

* The Command class encapsulates the commands that can be done by Kenobi.
* @return A string containing the feedback of the execution.
* Sets the data required for commands to execute.
* @param taskList The TaskList to which the command is to be executed.
* The DeleteCommand class encapsulates the command to delete a Task from a given TaskList.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the index of the task to be deleted.
* Executes the deletion of a Task into the TaskList.
* @return a feedback from the execution of the command.
return "I removed the following task:\n" + deletedTask;
return "The task you are trying to delete is not in the archives.";
* The ExitCommand class encapsulates the command to exit the Kenobi program.
* Executes the termination of the Kenobi program.
* @return a feedback from the execution of the command.
* The FindCommand class encapsulates the command to find a Task to a given TaskList.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the given search term to find the desired Task.
* @param searchTerm The term to be searched in the TaskList.
* Executes the search of a Task in the TaskList.
* @return a feedback from the execution of the command.
return "Nothing in the archives matches your search term";

* The InvalidCommand class encapsulates the commands unknown to the Kenobi program.
* Returns the feedback of an invalid command.
* @return a feedback from the execution of the command.
return "It's not in the archives! Your command is invalid";
* The ListCommand class encapsulates the command to list a given TaskList.
* Executes the listing of the TaskList.
* @return a feedback from the execution of the command.
return "You don't have no tasks in the archives";
return "Here are all of your tasks in the archives\n" + tasks;
* The MarkCommand class encapsulates the command to mark a Task in a given TaskList as done.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the given index.
* @param index The base-1 index of the task to be marked.
* Executes the marking of the desired task.
* @return a feedback from the execution of the command.
return "The archives contain no such task";
* The UnmarkCommand class encapsulates the command to mark a Task in a given TaskList as undone.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the given index.
* @param index The base-1 index of the task to be unmarked.
* Executes the unmarking of the desired task.
* @return a feedback from the execution of the command.
return "I guess you weren't done with this one:\n" + tasks.markTaskAsUndone(toUnmarkIndex);

* The parser class encapsulates the parse functionality of Kenobi.

* @return a Command object encapsulating the parsed command.
* @throws ParseException if the Parser could not parse the command

* The Storage class encapsulates the storage functionality of Kenobi.
* Constructs a new Storage with the specified save path.
* @param savePath The path that directs to the storage that Kenobi uses.
* Loads existing tasks in savePath if exists.
* @return a TaskList containing the tasks from savePath or an empty TaskList if savePath doesn't exist.
System.out.println("WARNING: Kenobi could not load the save files");

* Saves the given TaskList to savePath.
* @param tasks The TaskList to be saved.
